intro: Muraltia brevifolia, commonly known as the short-leaved muraltia, is a species of flowering plant in the Fabaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its small, trifoliate leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It produces small, round pods that contain several seeds. Muraltia brevifolia is often found in dry, open woodlands and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils.
